content.user_title: Scan Python Code for Security Vulnerabilities
content.value_statement: Python code often contains hidden security risks like hardcoded passwords, SQL injection flaws, and command injection vulnerabilities. This skill integrates Bandit SAST scanning to automatically detect security issues in your Python codebase and maps findings to industry security frameworks.
actual_capabilities: Scan Python files and directories for security vulnerabilities using Bandit
Generate security reports with severity and confidence classifications
Map findings to CWE identifiers and OWASP Top 10 categories
Provide remediation guidance with secure code examples
Configure pre-commit hooks for git workflow integration
Integrate security scanning into CI/CD pipelines
limitations: Only scans Python code; other languages not supported
Detects known patterns; may miss business logic vulnerabilities
Results may include false positives requiring manual review
Cannot detect vulnerabilities in compiled dependencies

faq.question: What Python versions does Bandit support?
faq.answer: Bandit supports Python 3.8 and later versions. The skill requires Python >=3.8.

faq.question: How long does a typical scan take?
faq.answer: Scan time depends on codebase size. Bandit parallelizes scans automatically. A typical 1000-line project scans in under 10 seconds.

faq.question: Can I integrate Bandit with my existing CI/CD tool?
faq.answer: Yes, Bandit works with GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, CircleCI, and other CI platforms. Config examples are included in the skill.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides documentation and configuration. Bandit runs locally on your machine and does not transmit code externally.

faq.question: Why am I seeing false positives?
faq.answer: Bandit uses pattern matching and may flag legitimate code. Use confidence filtering (-i flag) or inline # nosec comments to suppress known false positives.

faq.question: How does this compare to other Python security tools?
faq.answer: Bandit focuses on Python-specific vulnerabilities like pickle deserialization and hardcoded secrets. Combine with Semgrep for broader coverage and Safety for dependency scanning.
